intro: Erigeron scoparioides, commonly known as the prairie coneflower, is a flowering plant native to the central and northern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as prairies and sandy soils. It features hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves, and produces showy blue to purple flowers in the summer. Erigeron scoparioides is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
